t: Isaiah 49
The Servant of the Lord
Listen*pn to me, O coastlands, and*ld give attention, you peoples from afar. The*ln Lord*s called me from the womb, from*ld the body of my mother he named my name.
He*ln made my mouth like a sharp sword; in*ld the shadow of his hand he hid me; he*ln made me a polished arrow; in*ld his quiver he hid me away.
And*ln he said to me, “You are my servant, Israel,*ld in whom I will be glorified.”
But*ln I said, “I have labored in vain; I*ld have spent my strength for nothing and vanity; yet*ln surely my right is with the Lord,*s and*ld my recompense with my God.”

And*pn now the Lord*s says, he*ld who formed me from the womb to be his servant, to*ln bring Jacob back to him; and*ld that Israel might be gathered to him— for*ln I am honored in the eyes of the Lord,*s and*ld my God has become my strength—

he*ln says: “It*ln is too light a thing that you should be my servant to*ld raise up the tribes of Jacob and*ld to bring back the preserved of Israel; I*ln will make you as a light for the nations, that*ld my salvation may reach to the end of the earth.”

Thus*pn says the Lord,*s the*ld Redeemer of Israel and his Holy One, to*ln one deeply despised, abhorred by the nation, the*ld servant of rulers: “Kings*ln shall see and arise; princes,*ld and they shall prostrate themselves; because*ln of the Lord,*s who is faithful, the*ld Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.”
The Restoration of Israel

Thus*pn says the Lord:*s “In*ln a time of favor I have answered you; in*ld a day of salvation I have helped you; I*ln will keep you and give you as*ld a covenant to the people, to*ln establish the land, to*ld apportion the desolate heritages,
saying*ln to the prisoners, ‘Come out,’ to*ld those who are in darkness, ‘Appear.’ They*ln shall feed along the ways; on*ld all bare heights shall be their pasture;
they*ln shall not hunger or thirst, neither*ld scorching wind nor sun shall strike them, for*ln he who has pity on them will lead them, and*ld by springs of water will guide them.
And*ln I will make all my mountains a road, and*ld my highways shall be raised up.
Behold,*ln these shall come from afar, and*ld behold, these from the north and from the west, and*ld these from the land of Syene.”
Sing*pn for joy, O heavens, and exult, O earth; break*ld forth, O mountains, into singing! For*ln the Lord*s has comforted his people and*ld will have compassion on his afflicted.
But*pn Zion said, “The Lord*s has forsaken me; my*ld Lord has forgotten me.”
“Can*pn a woman forget her nursing child, that*ld she should have no compassion on the son of her womb? Even*ln these may forget, yet*ld I will not forget you.
Behold,*ln I have engraved you on the palms of my hands; your*ld walls are continually before me.
Your*ln builders make haste; your*ld destroyers and those who laid you waste go out from you.
Lift*ln up your eyes around and see; they*ld all gather, they come to you. As*ln I live, declares the Lord,*s you*ld shall put them all on as an ornament; you*ld shall bind them on as a bride does.
“Surely*pn your waste and your desolate places and*ld your devastated land— surely*ln now you will be too narrow for your inhabitants, and*ld those who swallowed you up will be far away.
The*ln children of your bereavement will*ld yet say in your ears: ‘The*ln place is too narrow for me; make*ld room for me to dwell in.’

Then*ln you will say in your heart: ‘Who*ld has borne me these? I*ln was bereaved and barren, exiled*ld and put away, but*ld who has brought up these? Behold,*ln I was left alone; from*ld where have these come?’”

Thus*pn says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*ln I will lift up my hand to the nations, and*ld raise my signal to the peoples; and*ln they shall bring your sons in their arms, and*ld your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.

Kings*ln shall be your foster fathers, and*ld their queens your nursing mothers. With*ln their faces to the ground they shall bow down to you, and*ld lick the dust of your feet. Then*ln you will know that I am the Lord;*s those*ld who wait for me shall not be put to shame.”
Can*pn the prey be taken from the mighty, or*ld the captives of a tyrant be rescued?

For*ln thus says the Lord:*s “Even*ln the captives of the mighty shall be taken, and*ld the prey of the tyrant be rescued, for*ln I will contend with those who contend with you, and*ld I will save your children.

I*ln will make your oppressors eat their own flesh, and*ld they shall be drunk with their own blood as with wine. Then*ln all flesh shall know that*ld I am the Lord*s your Savior, and*ld your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”
